p: Another drug with similar mechanism of action is BCX4430 (Galidesivir), which showed strong antiviral activity against yellow fever and several others viruses in previous studies, and was recently tested against ZIKV [ 133]. It was able to reduce cytopathic effect and viral load in Vero76, Huh7 and RD cell lines infected with African, Asian, or American ZIKV strains [ 92]. Furthermore, in a model of lethal infection in adult immunodeficient mice, treatment with BCX4430 for 8 days, starting 4 h prior to infection was able to improve survival and prevent infection-induced weight loss. Similar results were obtained when the drug was given 1 or 3 days post-infection [ 92]. A preliminary study in Rhesus monkeys indicated good tolerability and efficacy of the candidate when given intramuscularly at a dose of 100 mg/kg on the day of infection followed by 25 mg/kg twice daily for 9 additional days [ 93]. As of January 2019, BioCryst Pharmaceuticals was recruiting for a Phase 1 human trial in order to test single dose safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of BCX4430 [ 134].
